author: The Bulletin
title: Local sports calendar
text: ONGOING The Connecticut Vipers are looking for players ages 9-18. For more info, email connecticutvipers@gmail.com The CT Dirtbags are looking for players for their 13-U, 14/15-U, 16-U and 19-U teams. For more info or to schedule a tryout, email program director Chris Ferrante at coachferrante@yahoo.com The Connecticut Aces are looking for high school players who want to play college baseball and are 2016 or 2017 high school grads. For more info, call team administrator Jeff Hartmann at (860) 391-0400 or email Jehartmann@comcast.net Team Connecticut Baseball is looking for players 14 and 15 to compete this fall on the Underclass Showcase team. For more information contact coach Chris Pomroy at cpomroy6@yahoo.com or call (860) 449-4052. AHEAD The Eastern Connecticut State University baseball program will offer futures clinics from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. on Sunday, Oct. 11 and from 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. on Saturday, Jan. 23 at Geissler Gymnasium. High school players grades 9 through 12 are eligible to participate at a cost of $150 per clinic. For more information contact ECSU coach Matt LaBranche at (860) 465-4516 or labranchem@easternct.edu. BASKETBALL ONGOING The Connecticut Playmakers AAU travel team is looking for coaches and players from ages 8-17 for the summer season. For more info, email Alick Furtick at ctplaymakersaau@gmail.com AHEAD International Association of Approved Basketball Officials Eastern Connecticut Board 8 seeks candidates interested in becoming a high school official for the upcoming season. Candidates are strongly encouraged to attend the rules classes in preparation for the written exam on Monday, Nov. 2. Rules classes will be at the NFA cafeteria from 6 to 8:15 p.m. on Sept. 29, Oct. 6, Oct. 13, Oct. 20, Oct. 27 and Oct. 29. For more information contact Mike Thomas at interpreter@iabbo8.org or (860) 912-6736 Colchester Youth Basketball will hold a girls basketball conditioning program for players in grades 7-12. The program will run from 6 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. on Tuesdays and Thursdays from Oct. 1 to Nov. 19 in Gym B. Lisa LaSaracina will coach the program, which will consist of conditioning and games. Cost is $50. Register online at eteamz.com/colchesteryouthbasketball International Association of Approved Basketball Officials Northeast Connecticut Board 35 seeks candidates interested in becoming a high school official for the upcoming season. An introduction and application session will be held at Killingly High at 6 p.m. on Oct. 16. Clinics will be held at the high school from 6 to 8 p.m. on Oct. 8, Oct. 13, Oct. 15, Oct. 20, Oct. 22, Oct. 27 and Oct. 29. A written exam will be at Killingly High at 6 p.m. on Nov. 2. For more information contact Peter Gerardi at my3sons76@charter.net or (860) 377-1068 Page 2 of 2 - The North Stonington Recreation department presents a shooting clinic with the Pro Shot Shooting System. The clinic will take place from 11 a.m.-3:30 p.m. on Saturday, Oct. 17 at Wheeler High and is open to boys and girls grade 6-12. The cost for town residents is $30 and $40 for non-town residents. Registration forms are available at http://www.northstoningtonct.gov/Pages/NStoningtonCT_BC/Rec/index . For more information email Neal Cobleigh at ncob@cox.net The third annual ShopRite Nutmeg State Games Holiday Tournament will be hosted by Wesleyan University on Dec. 26-28. The tournament is open for boys and girls travel teams in the sixth, seventh and eighth grade and has a three-game guarantee. Entry fee is $350 per team. For more information email nutmeg@nutmegstategames.org or call (860) 788-7041. FOOTBALL ONGOING The Eastern Connecticut Board of Approved Football Officials is looking for new male and female members for this season and beyond. Members must be over 18 years of age and pass the Connecticut Interscholastic Athletic Conference background check. Interested applicants can visit www.ecfo.org or email recruiting@efco.org to indicate interest, ask questions or download an application. SOCCER ONGOING The Mendonca Soccer School is running a full-year player development program, Doca Futebol Academy. Training sessions will be run by coaches Joe Mendonca Sr., Joe Mendonca Jr. and Jen Sullivan in southeastern Connecticut communities. For more info or to try out, email mendoncasoccer@yahoo.com SOFTBALL ONGOING The CT Mirage 14-U Black team is looking for players. Players entering the ninth grade in September should email coach Brian Jacobs at coachjacobs23@hotmail.com The CT Challengers 14-U team is looking for players. For more info, call Randy Ortiz at (860) 942-3829 or email ranjames70@yahoo.com Stealth Fastpitch Softball 14-U team is looking for a few players born in 2000 or 2001 to complete the roster. If you are interested in playing competitive travel softball in a positive learning environment contact ctristealth@yahoo.com or visit www.stealthri.com for more information. To submit items to the sports calendar, email sports@norwichbulletin.com and include all pertinent information, as well as how long it is to run. There is no cost, and the calendar runs online every Monday and in print when space allows throughout the week. By The Bulletin
